OrderSubsystem

Class OrderCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • OrderSubsystem.OrderCollection

  • public class OrderCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class Implements the Collection of Orders and the Cart Data Structure It contain the use cases to create an order the Shopping cart use case functions The Make Payment use case involved in the Order payment The cancel order used to get rid of an order that has been created and has not been shipped yet, this will change the objects status to cancelled however it will still be in the viewOrderHistory This class also provides the ShipOrder Use case for the Administrator as well as the viewOrderHistory to view the current users order History.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    James McCarthy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrderCollection()
      This is the default constructor for the OrderCollections class it creates the Order Collection for a guest who has not logged in as a User or an Admin.
      OrderCollection(java.lang.String accountId)
      OverLoaded Constructor constructs the Order Collections with an Order History that will be filled by the DB passed into the Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderCollection

        public OrderCollection()

        This is the default constructor for the OrderCollections class it creates the Order Collection for a guest who has not logged in as a User or an Admin. Creates the two data structures used in the Order Management Subsystem One being the Shopping Cart Linked List, b/c of quick insert and removal

      • OrderCollection

        public OrderCollection(java.lang.String accountId)

        OverLoaded Constructor constructs the Order Collections with an Order History that will be filled by the DB passed into the Constructors

        Parameters:
        orderHistory - - The current Order History that it already tied to the User Account. This is done by filling the hash array with the appropriate Orders from the Users Order stored in the DB.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrder

        public boolean createOrder(java.util.LinkedList<ProductManagementSystem.Product> prodList,
                           double salesTotal,
                           application.Account accountIn)
        After the Order Object is created with payment information and all requires attributes filled. The order may be created and added to the DB in the appropriate table.
        Parameters:
        prodList - - The Shopping Cart tied to the order
        salesTotal - - The Sales total of all items in the cart
        accountIn - - The ID of the account making the order
        Returns:

        public Order removeOrder(java.lang.String orderId)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Order - The Order Object that was deleted null - if order was not found.

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Order> ViewOrderHistory(java.lang.String accId)
        Displays the Order History for the User. The Orders the User has made are extracted from the DB and displays them.
        Parameters:
        AccId- - The id of the account you would like to get the order history for.
        Returns:
        Returns the Hash Map for the ORder History
